results.title: Going Solo
results.brief_description:
Through life experiences such as divorce, bereavement or never meeting the right soulmate we may find ourselves fifty plus and living on our own. For some in this situation a new partner is not what they crave, just the supportive friendship of those who understand.

Based on a series of interviews conducted with members of a Catholic Women’s solo group, this 36 min amateur documentary is a first time effort for the filmmaker and although the production values are at times questionable - the heart and soul of the women interviewed shine through making this a warm, often funny and inspirational account of life for a growing number of people in our community.

results.title: Godard 80
results.brief_description: The famous French director Jean-Luc Godard is interviewed by British film theorist Peter Wollen and the editor of “Framework”, Don Ranveaud. He talks of the developments in his work, the change in style epitomised by his most recent film “Sauve Qui Peut”, his work with Francis Ford Coppola and the relationships between his previous films and the new one. He also discusses his radical method of scriptwriting and the critical responses to his latest film.

results.title: God with a green face
results.creator_credit: Myron Emery, Bruce A. Ward and American Society for Eastern Arts
results.brief_description: This colourful introduction to India’s greatest theatre tradition - the dance-drama of Kathakali features the Kerala Kalamadalam Company performing dances of the State of Kerala which have evolved out of the Sanskrit tradition and the indigenous Dravidian culture. The dancers display a great richness of costume, vivid colour and originality of head-dress.

results.title: Go, sober and safe
results.creator_credit: Earl Deems and Highway Safety Films
results.brief_description: More than 50% of all traffic deaths in the USA are caused by drinking drivers. How people are actually affected by alcohol depends very much on body weight, amount of food in the stomach and length of time over which the alcohol was consumed. Diagramatically the film explains how alcohol works and shows a test worked out to show how alcohol affects driving ability.

results.title: Go Between. My Name Is Asher Lev
results.brief_description: Designed for senior students of English, this programme features a lecture on the “The Go-between”, by L.P. Hartley, and “My name is Asher Lev” by Chaim Potok. Critical issues and significant passages are discussed.

results.title: Gloucester Cathedral
results.brief_description: A study of Gloucester Cathedral; within the building are great circular columns of Norman architecture; vaulting of the nave and choir is rich in style; painted glass windows date from the 14th century; detailed studies of the cloisters and the fan tracery.
results.description: A study of Gloucester Cathedral; within the building are great circular columns of Norman architecture; vaulting of the nave and choir is rich in style; painted glass windows date from the 14th century; detailed studies of the cloisters and the fan tracery.

results.title: Glooscap country
results.brief_description: Ancient legend of the Micmac Indians of Nova Scotia. The rich scenic panorama of Nova Scotia’s Minas Basin gives substance to the story of Glooscap, an Indian God who was believed to live on what is now Cape Blomidon and from his mountain retreat to watch over his people in the valleys and forests below.
